TopicTitle: What is Magic Boulder Made Of?

Articles.Content:
Everyone knows Magic Boulder. That glitchy green-striped gray boulder that orbited Ike (that disappeared ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)) was a great easter egg. But what was it composed of?

 First of all, we need to look at it. [http://i.imgur.com/1lk4GRW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1lk4GRW.jpg)

 It's a medium-small grey boulder (hence the name) with green, presumably glowing, stripes.

 What could it be made of?
Krakenide.
It's made of pure awesomeness.

It was made of hatred. Hatred towards the rest of the Universe. It destroyed everything that touched it (go see Brotoro's AAR). Finally, when it couldn't bear being near the rest of the system anymore, it quantum tunneled itself out of it - again propelled only by pure hatred.
It's obviously made of the remains of all those poor kerbals that magically disappear in grey dust. That's why it's green-grey-ish and magic
100% Pure Unfindium
Unobtainium possibly ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Tiberium

> 
> What could it be made of?

Applebee'sÃ¢â€žÂ¢

It's a kraken egg.

The green stripes are the cracks in the shell.

And since it's now gone, it must have hatched!

It's made from nothing, as it no longer frikkin exists!

#Bringbackthemagicboulder
Common volcanic basalt, with unusually high concentrations of love.
[Ununoctium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ununoctium)in the highest density imaginable.

> 
> Common volcanic basalt, with unusually high concentrations of love.

Nova used to be a dev, so maybe we should take his word for it.
Also, the Magic Bolder was the ultimate Pet Rock. That was because the text on the monolith was a reference to Pet Rock, and the Magic Boulder was the ultimate thing.
From the pictures I've seen of it, it looks radioactive.
Where do you *think* we mine the hype-fuel from?

> 
> Where do you *think* we mine the hype-fuel from?

Um... the Magic Boulder doesn't exist anymore. Just saying.

![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
I think that the Boulder could be made of a hardened, frozen mass of Mystery Goo... that would explain its strange properties and glowing-ness.
It used to contain quite high levels of occultum, but due to something involving magnets, the levels of occultum increased to critical levels which is why it can't be found anymore
It was made of pixels.

> And since it's now gone, it must have hatched!

Is that why Pol is a glitchy mess of invisible mines?

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I think that the Boulder could be made of a hardened, frozen mass of Mystery Goo... that would explain its strange properties and glowing-ness.

It very well could be. We never saw what Mystery Goo looked like.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> It's obviously made of the remains of all those poor kerbals that magically disappear in grey dust. That's why it's green-grey-ish and magic

> 
> It was made of hatred. Hatred towards the rest of the Universe. It destroyed everything that touched it (go see Brotoro's AAR). Finally, when it couldn't bear being near the rest of the system anymore, it quantum tunneled itself out of it - again propelled only by pure hatred.

It might be both. Think about it: If you died in the Kerbal Space Program, you would hate it, as it killed you. It could be dead kerbal dust infused with the hate-filled souls of the dead kerbals, and since they hate the space program, they destroy any ships sent by it.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Applebee'sÃ¢â€žÂ¢

Applebee'sÃ¢â€žÂ¢? Orbiting Ike?

- - - Updated - - -

Well, there have been many humorous answers, but I was looking for a material composition of the Boulder.

(Not to say that anyone's wrong, but they just didn't have the... 'direct' answer I was looking for.)
Explodium. LOTS of explodium...
Antimatter, just like in Larry Niven's story *flatlander*.

Unobtanium, Blutonium, Explodium, Urlumium, Plocknium, Wernhernium, Goliathium, Explodium, Propellium, Balloonium, Oxium, platenum, toroidold, batmerrilium, Lithosium, Kolusium, Keomanetonium, Nobleium, unonium, unonnilium, unonbium, antimattium...

\*Starts listing whole Kerbal table of elements\*

My point is, it's made of everything. That is why it is so unstable. It destroys ships and kerbals that go near it from the intense radiation, and it disappeared because it collapsed in on itself and created a wormhole.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-08T18:45:22Z" title="04/08/2015 06:45  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 8, 2015</time> by Rolanvorxariat**
What's the magic boulder made off? Hopes, dreams and empty promises.
